title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks in September
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'Stand by Me,' 'Paddington,' and 'The Four Seasons' to September's streaming lineup.
Peacock streams 'The Paper,' a spinoff of 'The Office' from creator Greg Daniels.
HBO Max releases 'Friendship,' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd, in a comedic suburban setting.

title: On the hunt for sharks in Boston Harbor
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Researchers from the Anderson Cabot Center are tagging juvenile sand tiger sharks in Boston Harbor for conservation efforts.
The team is led by Ryan Knotek, aiming to tag 40-50 sharks to seek NOAA habitat protection status.
Tagging involves implanting transmitters to study shark movements; 25 have been tagged so far this season.

title: Police seek help finding alleged shooter who escaped on scooter
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Police seek help identifying a suspect in an Aug. 16 shooting at 326 Harvard St., Dorchester.
The suspect fled on a scooter wearing a white shirt, blue jeans, possibly a helmet, heading towards Walk Hill Street.
Victim suffered serious injuries from multiple gunshots; police request information via 617-343-4712 or 1-800-494-TIPS.

title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E fair in West Springfield features diverse food vendors, offering fried, baked, and smothered delicacies from September 12-28.
The Vermont Wine & Harvest Festival showcases New England wineries, distilleries, and specialty foods from September 19-20 in West Dover and Wilmington.
Salem hosts over 100 food trucks at the Salem Food Truck & Craft Beverage Festival on September 20-21.

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, Emmy nominee for 'Somebody Somewhere,' joins the new episode of the Love Letters podcast.
Hiller shares a personal story about a breakup and lessons learned in his 20s on the podcast.
The episode touches on famous romantic speeches from films like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill.'

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to charges of kidnapping and murdering his 38-year-old sister, Michelle Knox, in Lynn.
Prosecutors accuse Smith of making statements about killing Knox outside the Newhall Street apartment where police responded.
Smith previously faced multiple charges, including pleading guilty to assault with a dangerous weapon in July.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders, highlighting defensive potential.
Landry, part of New England's offseason defensive signings, emphasized improving consistency following the season-opening setback.
Despite a strong pass rush, Patriots allowed 362 passing yards, showing room for defensive improvement against explosive plays.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews criticized the Patriots' run game performance in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots managed only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, with focus shifting to passing instead.
Coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged the need for New England to improve run efficiency for offensive balance.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm prepares for his first training camp as Bruins head coach starting September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm emphasizes intensity, accountability, and new standards to strengthen a retooling Bruins roster after last season's poor record.
Improving defense and power play are priorities for Sturm, aiming to enhance the Bruins' performance in the 2025 season.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert is on trial for charges including child kidnapping and attempted murder in Worcester, Massachusetts.
The victim, now 15, testified that Hubert threw her off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond in 2017.
The trial has faced delays since 2020, with Hubert pleading not guilty and seeking acquittal on all charges.
